content: David Pardo is a Berlin based Data Scientist currently working at Medwing. He is interested in processing and analysing data in order to bring actionable results to different business areas. In order to achieve this he is constantly learning about all the steps in the data journey, from the Data Engineering tasks related to extracting and structuring data to the modeling, visualisation and communication that make the data useful to the final business user. In his free time he enjoys literature, films, philosophy, history, music, photography, generative art, playing football, hiking, diving and traveling as much as he can.
summary: David Pardo is a Berlin based Data Scientist currently working at Medwing. He is interested in processing and analysing data in order to bring actionable results to different business areas. In order to achieve this he is constantly learning about all the steps in the data journey, from the Data Engineering tasks related to extracting and structuring data to the modeling, visualisation and communication that make the data useful to the final business user.
title: David Pardo

content:
Flexibility This feature can be used for publishing content such as:
 Online courses Project or software documentation Tutorials  The courses folder may be renamed. For example, we can rename it to docs for software/project documentation or tutorials for creating an online course.
Delete tutorials To remove these pages, delete the courses folder and see below to delete the associated menu link.
Update site menu After renaming or deleting the courses folder, you may wish to update any [[main]] menu links to it by editing your menu configuration at config/_default/menus.toml.
For example, if you delete this folder, you can remove the following from your menu configuration:
[[main]] name = "Courses" url = "courses/" weight = 50  Or, if you are creating a software documentation site, you can rename the courses folder to docs and update the associated Courses menu configuration to:
[[main]] name = "Docs" url = "docs/" weight = 50  Update the docs menu If you use the docs layout, note that the name of the menu in the front matter should be in the form [menu.X] where X is the folder name. Hence, if you rename the courses/example/ folder, you should also rename the menu definitions in the front matter of files within courses/example/ from [menu.example] to [menu.<NewFolderName>].
summary: Learn how to use Academic's docs layout for publishing online courses, software documentation, and tutorials.
title: Overview

title: Example Page 2

content:
Click on the Slides button above to view the built-in slides feature.   Slides can be added in a few ways:
 Create slides using Academic’s Slides feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes.  Further talk details can easily be added to this page using Markdown and $\rm \LaTeX$ math code.
summary: An example talk using Academic's Markdown slides feature.
title: Example Talk

content:
There is always something to learn 17th of April Configuring R and workflow in a Mac:
 Install Xcode in order to get git: https://osxdaily.com/2014/02/12/install-command-line-tools-mac-os-x/
 Get key pair: https://secure.vexxhost.com/billing/index.php/knowledgebase/171/How-can-I-generate-SSH-keys-on-Mac-OS-X.html
 Show hidden files: Cmd + Shift + .
   18th of April Each time that I open Twitter without a concrete plan afterwards, it goes on for ages. I must always have a plan in mind, one that is compatible with my daily habits. No more random Whatsapp and Twitter checking. Go back to writing one tweet each time you use it!
 19th of April How to connect to Redshift: Download VSCode. Add the extension SQLTools:https://vscode-sqltools.mteixeira.dev/. Add a Keybord shortcut for ‘Run selected query’.
The VPN might not work: In advanced Network preferences tick ‘Send all requests through the VPN connection’. Restart the computer.
Modify author of git commit: https://www.git-tower.com/learn/git/faq/change-author-name-email
 20th of April Started to work into memory, audiobook: Moonwalking with Einstein
Colombia’s oil is Brent not WTI: https://www.investopedia.com/ask/answers/052615/what-difference-between-brent-crude-and-west-texas-intermediate.asp
Docker: Runs in http://localhost:8888/
 21th of April Git: git revert Three way merge Pull requests: first goes the branch you want to merge INTO!
Memory: Associate names with memorable images to remember them easily!
 22th of April Git: Create commit with a different date: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3895453/how-do-i-make-a-git-commit-in-the-past
 23rd of April Hugo Academic theme: widget pages https://sourcethemes.com/academic/docs/managing-content/#create-a-widget-page
 24th of April German: 15:51:29 From Berit Lingoda : hat mir mein Vater vorgelesen und dann habe ich selbst angefangen zu lesen. El niño que mató 7 moscas: das tapfere Schneiderlei 15:53:30 From Berit Lingoda : lein 15:57:53 From Berit Lingoda : https://www.dw.com/de/die-vespa-ist-kult/l-49363624 15:58:52 From Berit Lingoda : https://sprachekulturkommunikation.com/deutsch-lernen/uebungen-b1-b2/ 15:59:15 From Berit Lingoda : https://learngerman.dw.com/de/grammar 16:00:08 From Berit Lingoda : https://www.deutsch-perfekt.com/deutsch-hoeren
 25th of April The cure for scurvy was found and lost some years after: https://idlewords.com/2010/03/scott_and_scurvy.htm
 26th of April Using RcppArmadillo: https://thecoatlessprofessor.com/programming/cpp/rcpp-rcpparmadillo-and-os-x-mavericks-lgfortran-and-lquadmath-error/
Watercolors art: https://fronkonstin.com/2020/03/26/watercolors/
 27th of April Sisyphus is an absurd man in his way back to the bottom of the summit. At that moment he holds no hope, but he’s in control of his own destiny, he can fully enjoy life because he’s conscious of its limitations, suffering and absurdity, and as such he can decide to fully make use of it on his own terms.
Always put your bike inside, and lock it properly, you idiot!
 28th of April Quantum Field Theory: https://web.physics.ucsb.edu/~mark/ms-qft-DRAFT.pdf
Literature about collective nation memories, such as in Portugal’s case with the earthquake??
Europe’s modern way: States present the good face and help developing nations while corporations do the dirty work without considerably stainint states in the process.
Simulation of black holes through supersonic fluids: https://twitter.com/QuantaMagazine/status/1255267856977219585?s=20
 29th of April Memory palaces for language learning: https://www.fluentin3months.com/memory-palace/
Lisbon earthquake: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1755_Lisbon_earthquake
Redshift optimisations: https://www.intermix.io/blog/3-mistakes-redshift-setup/
 30th of April Indistractable, regain focus: https://www.nirandfar.com/indistractable/
Meadow = pasture = Weide = pastos
Git, modify date of old commit: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/454734/how-can-one-change-the-timestamp-of-an-old-commit-in-git
 1st of May Angedeutet = implied, indicated. Andeuten = indicate, suggest
There are apps to save articles and read them, to control distraction and to block certain websites.
 2nd of May Prometteur = prometedor
 3rd of May Gregorius VII, the pope that excommunicated Heinrich IV, was a church reformist (and probably the one after whom we have the Gregorian calendar)
Stander = The stick for leaving the bike standing, in Dutch.
 4th of May Neu-Venedig is a town to the east of Müggelsee consistent of quite some canals. A place to be visited!
 5th of May A query to automatically create ‘create table’ statements in Redshift: https://discourse.snowplowanalytics.com/t/generating-redshift-ddl-create-statements-for-tables-that-already-exist/556
Looker extends
Jordan’s first title was in 91, after two lost finals
Colourlovers R package: https://github.com/andrewheiss/colourlovers
 6th of May Ferreteria is Hardware store in english haha, der Baumarkt, la quincaillerie.
“A need to tell and hear stories is essential to the species Homo sapiens—second in necessity apparently after nourishment and before love and shelter.” —Reynolds Price, from A Palpable God.
Graphic design for data: https://datavizm20.classes.andrewheiss.com/slides/02-slides.html#48
 7th of May Abandoned prison in Loos, close to Lille.
 8th of May einfallen -> colapsar/implosionare anfassen -> agarrar berühren -> tocar zer -> prefijo para acciones que implican dispersión/destrucción/desintegración be -> prefijo para cuando una acción implica a un “otro”, ya sea objeto o ser (es una hipótesis, falta comprobarlo)
 9th of May sarebbe bello/ottimo…, para decir estaría bien…, sería bacano…
 10th of May déceler = detectar, descubrir or = ahora bien acquitter = absolver se borner = limitarse
 11th of May smother = asfixiar = étouffer = ersticken
Redshift: Use IDENTITY(1,1) to generate unique keys (if necessary)
 12th of May German verb prefixes: https://www.fluentu.com/blog/german/german-prefixes/
legen - to lay erlegen - to kill (mostly used by hunting)
stechen - to sting erstechen - to kill someone by knife
hängen - to hang erhängen - to die by hanging (gallows)
schlagen - to hit erschlagen - to kill someone by using a dull item
 13th of May Tubes around Berlin: http://www.berlinglobal.org/index.php?the-berlin-mystery-of-the-pink-pipes
Tricks for filtering in Tidyverse: https://sebastiansauer.github.io/dplyr_filter/
summary:
There is always something to learn 17th of April Configuring R and workflow in a Mac:
 Install Xcode in order to get git: https://osxdaily.com/2014/02/12/install-command-line-tools-mac-os-x/
 Get key pair: https://secure.
title: Learnings

content:
My first Tidy Tuesday This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com.
You can embed an R code chunk like this:
tdf_winners <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2020/2020-04-07/tdf_winners.csv') ## Parsed with column specification: ## cols( ## edition = col_double(), ## start_date = col_date(format = ""), ## winner_name = col_character(), ## winner_team = col_character(), ## distance = col_double(), ## time_overall = col_double(), ## time_margin = col_double(), ## stage_wins = col_double(), ## stages_led = col_double(), ## height = col_double(), ## weight = col_double(), ## age = col_double(), ## born = col_date(format = ""), ## died = col_date(format = ""), ## full_name = col_character(), ## nickname = col_character(), ## birth_town = col_character(), ## birth_country = col_character(), ## nationality = col_character() ## ) #fit <- lm(dist ~ speed, data = cars) #fit  Including Plots You can also embed plots. See Figure 1 for example:
par(mar = c(0, 1, 0, 1)) pie( c(280, 60, 20), c('Sky', 'Sunny side of pyramid', 'Shady side of pyramid'), col = c('#0292D8', '#F7EA39', '#C4B632'), init.angle = -50, border = NA )  Figure 1: A fancy pie chart.
summary: My first Tidy Tuesday This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.
title: Tidy Tuesday

content: Click the Slides button above to demo Academic’s Markdown slides feature.   Supplementary notes can be added here, including code and math.

title: An example preprint / working paper

content:
Create slides in Markdown with Academic  Academic | Documentation
 Features  Efficiently write slides in Markdown 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides Supports speaker notes Mobile friendly slides   Controls  Next: Right Arrow or Space Previous: Left Arrow Start: Home Finish: End Overview: Esc Speaker notes: S Fullscreen: F Zoom: Alt + Click  PDF Export: E   Code Highlighting Inline code: variable
Code block:
porridge = "blueberry" if porridge == "blueberry": print("Eating...")   Math In-line math: $x + y = z$
Block math:
$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$
 Fragments Make content appear incrementally
{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}  Press Space to play!
One  Two  Three 
 A fragment can accept two optional parameters:
 class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS) weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears   Speaker Notes Add speaker notes to your presentation
{{% speaker_note %}} - Only the speaker can read these notes - Press `S` key to view {{% /speaker_note %}}  Press the S key to view the speaker notes!
 Only the speaker can read these notes Press S key to view    Themes  black: Black background, white text, blue links (default) white: White background, black text, blue links league: Gray background, white text, blue links beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links    night: Black background, thick white text, orange links serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links simple: White background, black text, blue links solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links   Custom Slide Customize the slide style and background
{{< slide background-image="/img/boards.jpg" >}} {{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}} {{< slide class="my-style" >}}   Custom CSS Example Let’s make headers navy colored.
Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:
.reveal section h1, .reveal section h2, .reveal section h3 { color: navy; }   Questions?  Ask
 Documentation
summary: An introduction to using Academic's Slides feature.
